title: More useful error message
body_html:
🚀 Feature

The error message "unexpected string for type kind" at the end of ModuleDecoder::buildType should probably include the string that was unexpected, to aid debugging.

Motivation

This is currently a black box error message, it doesn't tell the user what went wrong or where. Reading the source code it looks like the string will likely be something the model developer will recognise.

Pitch

Replace the last line of the function to instead use the exception description "unexpected string '' for type kind"
body_text:
🚀 Feature
The error message "unexpected string for type kind" at the end of ModuleDecoder::buildType should probably include the string that was unexpected, to aid debugging.
Motivation
This is currently a black box error message, it doesn't tell the user what went wrong or where. Reading the source code it looks like the string will likely be something the model developer will recognise.
Pitch
Replace the last line of the function to instead use the exception description "unexpected string '' for type kind"
body:
## 🚀 Feature
The error message "unexpected string for type kind" at the end of ModuleDecoder::buildType should probably include the string that was unexpected, to aid debugging.

## Motivation

This is currently a black box error message, it doesn't tell the user what went wrong or where. Reading the source code it looks like the string will likely be something the model developer will recognise.

## Pitch

Replace the last line of the function to instead use the exception description "unexpected string '<the string>' for type kind"
